description.narrative: Output 5.2: Increased national capacity to provide access to age-appropriate, quality learning opportunities and minimize the effects of disasters on learning., which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5: By 2020, all boys and girls, including young people, have increased and more equitable access to, and completion of, quality, inclusive education, with improved learning outcomes.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.2: Increased national capacity to provide access to age-appropriate, quality learning opportunities and minimize the effects of disasters on learning.

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical and financial support to Ministry of Primary and Secondary Education to roll out the competency-based curriculum that has progressed into the third year, with Phase 3 now covering Grade 5. All the schools across the country now use the new curriculum framework and syllabi in Grade 5 as a result of capacity building of teachers and textbook distribution to 5,441 disadvantaged schools, benefiting 1.27 million learners (Female 630,746 and Male 639,581). Among the 103,579 learners affected by Cyclone Idai, 77,923 learners benefited from UNICEF's support through supply distribution and emergency school improvement grants. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
